abstract.text: A

object is used for accessing the attributes of an identity stored in an identity authority. You can use an identity object for finding identities, and storing them in an access control list (ACL). If you need to edit these attributes, take advantage of the
class in Core Services.

abstract.text: Find and access identities, that is, users and groups. Display the Identity Picker, which lets users create and select identities.
An object of the
class represents a group identity and is used for viewing the attributes of group identities from an identity authority. The principal attributes of a
object are a POSIX group identifier (GID) and a list of members.
A

object is used for accessing the attributes of an identity stored in an identity authority. You can use an identity object for finding identities, and storing them in an access control list (ACL). If you need to edit these attributes, take advantage of the
class in Core Services.
Returns an opaque object for use with the Core Services Identity API.
Returns an array of aliases (alternate names) for the identity.
Returns the identity authority where the identity is stored.
Returns the email address of an identity.
Returns the full name of the identity.
Returns an identity object created from the specified Core Services Identity opaque object.
Returns the image associated with an identity.
Returns the identity object with the given name from the specified identity authority.
Returns the identity object matching the persistent reference data.
Returns the identity object with the given UUID from the specified identity authority.
Returns a Boolean value indicating the state of the identityâ€™s hidden property.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the identity is a member of the specified group.
Returns a persistent reference to store a reference to an identity.
Returns the POSIX name of the identity.
Returns the UUID of the identity as a string.
An object of the
class represents a user identity and is used for accessing the attributes of a user identity from an identity authority. The principal attributes of
are a POSIX user identifier (UID), password, and certificate.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
